numbered_ace_sentences: 1. I notice a pattern in the survey.
2. In almost all surveyed countries, more younger people believe that the world is getting better with each generation than older people.
3. This pattern could be due to a life-cycle effect.
4. A life-cycle effect is an effect that younger people have a more optimistic view of the world.
5. Younger people may lack experience.
6. I notice another pattern in the survey.
7. Peru is a South American country.
8. Brazil is a South American country.
9. Argentina is a South American country.
10. Peru is less optimistic overall than many other countries.
11. Brazil is less optimistic overall than many other countries.
12. Argentina is less optimistic overall than many other countries.
13. Zimbabwe is an African country.
14. Ethiopia is an African country.
15. Nigeria is an African country.
16. Kenya is an African country.
17. Zimbabwe is more optimistic overall than many other countries.
18. Ethiopia is more optimistic overall than many other countries.
19. Nigeria is more optimistic overall than many other countries.
20. Kenya is more optimistic overall than many other countries.
21. I wonder about Indonesia.
22. Indonesia is the strongest believer in the graph.
23. Indonesia believes that the world is getting better with each generation.
24. Indonesia is stronger than other countries by a large amount in the graph.
25. The title for the graph is "Percentage of believers that the world is improving generationally".
